name: Khaliji Music
description: Musical traditions of Eastern Arabia and the Persian Gulf region, roughly covering the Arabic-speaking people of the modern countries of the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain, Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Oman, Iraq, and Iran.

children.name: Ayyalah
children.description: Traditional Khaliji-Bedouin weapon performance, commonly found across the United Arab Emirates and Northwestern Oman.

children.name: Ayyalah
children.description: Traditional Khaliji-Bedouin weapon performance, commonly found across the United Arab Emirates and Northwestern Oman.

children.name: Fijiri
children.description: Deeply rooted in the Persian Gulf pearl diving culture, and sung during weekly gatherings combining solo and choral sections with minimal percussion.

children.name: Fijiri
children.description: Deeply rooted in the Persian Gulf pearl diving culture, and sung during weekly gatherings combining solo and choral sections with minimal percussion.

children.name: Liwa
children.description: Traditional Khaliji performance with East African Music roots centered around the mizmar and traditional drums, typically sung in Khaliji Arabic and Swahili.

children.name: Liwa
children.description: Traditional Khaliji performance with East African Music roots centered around the mizmar and traditional drums, typically sung in Khaliji Arabic and Swahili.

children.name: Nuban
children.description: Traditional Afro-Emirati Folk performance of Nuban origin most commonly performed in the emirate of Dubai.

children.name: Nuban
children.description: Traditional Afro-Emirati Folk performance of Nuban origin most commonly performed in the emirate of Dubai.

children.name: Samri
children.description: Traditional dance from Najd, Saudi Arabia, performed by two opposing rows of men who face each other, dancing and moving to the rhythm, in addition to a percussion ensemble.

children.name: Samri
children.description: Traditional dance from Najd, Saudi Arabia, performed by two opposing rows of men who face each other, dancing and moving to the rhythm, in addition to a percussion ensemble.

children.name: Sawt
children.description: Poetic vocal form with complex rhythms, emotive singing, and distinctive lute-backed melodies commonly found in the Gulf region and based on a maqam system.

children.name: Sawt
children.description: Poetic vocal form with complex rhythms, emotive singing, and distinctive lute-backed melodies commonly found in the Gulf region and based on a maqam system.

children.name: Shehhi Music
children.description: Musical traditions of the Shihuh, an Arabian tribe native to the United Arab Emirates and Oman.

children.name: Shehhi Music
children.description: Musical traditions of the Shihuh, an Arabian tribe native to the United Arab Emirates and Oman.

children.name: Shilla
children.description: Traditional style of sung Nabati poetry, prevalent across the Arabian Peninsula.
